alert.note: Alert for Bent; Crowley; Kiowa; Otero (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 11:00PM MDT until July 06 at 2:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Bent County in southeastern Colorado... Crowley County in southeastern Colorado... Southwestern Kiowa County in southeastern Colorado... Northern Otero County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 215 AM MDT. * At 1100 PM MDT, Significant flooding was occurring in the town of Las Animas in Bent county. Flooding is up to peoples doors in town. Long term residents have reported that they have not ever seen the flooding this bad. Roads are not passable and the power is out throughout the highway 50 corridor. No additional heavy rain is expected, but due to the ongoing flooding, this flash flood warning is being extended through 2:15 AM. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... La Junta, North La Junta, Rocky Ford, Las Animas, Fowler, Ordway, Swink, Manzanola, Olney Springs, Sugar City, Cheraw, Crowley, Haswell, Arlington, Blue Lake, John Martin Reservoir, Hasty, McClave, Fort Lyon and Caddoa. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
